Class CharCharMap

java.lang.Object
regexodus.ds.CharCharMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CharCharMap extends Object implements Serializable
An unordered map where the keys are unboxed chars and the values are also unboxed chars. Null keys are not allowed. No allocation is done except when growing the table size.

This class performs fast contains and remove (typically O(1), worst case O(n) but that is rare in practice). Add may be slightly slower, depending on hash collisions. Hashcodes are rehashed to reduce collisions and the need to resize. Load factors greater than 0.91 greatly increase the chances to resize to the next higher POT size.

Unordered sets and maps are not designed to provide especially fast iteration.

You can customize most behavior of this map by extending it. place(char) can be overridden to change how hashCodes are calculated (which can be useful for types like StringBuilder that don't implement hashCode()), and locateKey(char) can be overridden to change how equality is calculated.

This implementation uses linear probing with the backward shift algorithm for removal. Hashcodes are rehashed using Fibonacci hashing, instead of the more common power-of-two mask, to better distribute poor hashCodes (see Malte Skarupke's blog post). Linear probing continues to work even when all hashCodes collide, just more slowly.

See Also:

    • mask

      protected int mask
      A bitmask used to confine hashcodes to the size of the table. Must be all 1 bits in its low positions, ie a power of two minus 1.

    • defaultReturnValue

      public char defaultReturnValue

  • Constructor Details

    • CharCharMap

      public CharCharMap()
      Creates a new map with an initial capacity of 51 and a load factor of 0.8.

    • CharCharMap

      public CharCharMap(int initialCapacity)
      Creates a new map with a load factor of 0.8.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - If not a power of two, it is increased to the next nearest power of two.

    • CharCharMap

      public CharCharMap(int initialCapacity, float loadFactor)
      Creates a new map with the specified initial capacity and load factor. This map will hold initialCapacity items before growing the backing table.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - If not a power of two, it is increased to the next nearest power of two.

    • CharCharMap

      public CharCharMap(CharCharMap map)
      Creates a new map identical to the specified map.

    • CharCharMap

      public CharCharMap(char[] keys, char[] values)
      Given two side-by-side arrays, one of keys, one of values, this constructs a map and inserts each pair of key and value into it. If keys and values have different lengths, this only uses the length of the smaller array.
      Parameters:
      keys - an array of keys
      values - an array of values

  • Method Details

    • clone

      public CharCharMap clone()
      Explicitly implemented, does not interact with the Object.clone() method, and simply calls CharCharMap(CharCharMap) with this CharCharMap as its argument.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a deep copy of this CharCharMap

    • place

      protected int place(char item)
      Returns an index >= 0 and <= mask for the specified item.

      The default behavior uses Fibonacci hashing; it simply gets the Object.hashCode() of item, multiplies it by a specific char constant related to the golden ratio, and makes an unsigned right shift by shift before casting to int and returning. This can be overridden to hash item differently, though all implementors must ensure this returns results in the range of 0 to mask, inclusive. If nothing else is changed, then unsigned-right-shifting an int or char by shift will also restrict results to the correct range.

      Parameters:
      item - a non-null Object; its hashCode() method should be used by most implementations.

    • locateKey

      protected int locateKey(char key)
      Returns the index of the key if already present, else -1 - index for the next empty index. This can be overridden to compare for equality differently than ==.

    • put

      public char put(char key, char value)
      Returns the old value associated with the specified key, or this map's defaultReturnValue if there was no prior value.

    • putOrDefault

      public char putOrDefault(char key, char value, char defaultValue)
      Returns the old value associated with the specified key, or the given defaultValue if there was no prior value.

    • putAll

      public void putAll(CharCharMap map)

    • putAll

      public void putAll(char[] keys, char[] values)
      Given two side-by-side arrays, one of keys, one of values, this inserts each pair of key and value into this map with put().
      Parameters:
      keys - an array of keys
      values - an array of values

    • putAll

      public void putAll(char[] keys, char[] values, int length)
      Given two side-by-side arrays, one of keys, one of values, this inserts each pair of key and value into this map with put().
      Parameters:
      keys - an array of keys
      values - an array of values
      length - how many items from keys and values to insert, at-most

    • putAll

      public void putAll(char[] keys, int keyOffset, char[] values, int valueOffset, int length)
      Given two side-by-side arrays, one of keys, one of values, this inserts each pair of key and value into this map with put().
      Parameters:
      keys - an array of keys
      keyOffset - the first index in keys to insert
      values - an array of values
      valueOffset - the first index in values to insert
      length - how many items from keys and values to insert, at-most

    • get

      public char get(char key)
      Returns the value for the specified key, or defaultReturnValue if the key is not in the map.
      Parameters:
      key - any char

    • getOrDefault

      public char getOrDefault(char key, char defaultValue)
      Returns the value for the specified key, or the default value if the key is not in the map.

    • remove

      public char remove(char key)

      public boolean notEmpty()
      Returns true if the map has one or more items.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of key-value mappings in this map. If the map contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE elements, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
      Returns:
      the number of key-value mappings in this map

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the map is empty.

    • defaultReturnValue

      public char defaultReturnValue()
      Gets the default value, a char which is returned by get(char) if the key is not found. If not changed, the default value is 0.
      Returns:
      the current default value

    • defaultReturnValue

      public void defaultReturnValue(char defaultReturnValue)
      Sets the default value, a char which is returned by get(char) if the key is not found. If not changed, the default value is 0. Note that getOrDefault(char, char) is also available, which allows specifying a "not-found" value per-call.
      Parameters:
      defaultReturnValue - may be any char; should usually be one that doesn't occur as a typical value

    • shrink

      public void shrink(int maximumCapacity)
      Reduces the size of the backing arrays to be the specified capacity / loadFactor, or less. If the capacity is already less, nothing is done. If the map contains more items than the specified capacity, the next highest power of two capacity is used instead.

    • clear

      public void clear(int maximumCapacity)
      Clears the map and reduces the size of the backing arrays to be the specified capacity / loadFactor, if they are larger.

    • clear

      public void clear()

    • containsValue

      public boolean containsValue(char value)
      Returns true if the specified value is in the map. Note this traverses the entire map and compares every value, which may be an expensive operation.

    • containsKey

      public boolean containsKey(char key)

    • findKey

      public char findKey(char value, char defaultKey)
      Returns the key for the specified value, or null if it is not in the map. Note this traverses the entire map and compares every value, which may be an expensive operation.

    • ensureCapacity

      public void ensureCapacity(int additionalCapacity)
      Increases the size of the backing array to accommodate the specified number of additional items / loadFactor. Useful before adding many items to avoid multiple backing array resizes.

      protected void resize(int newSize)
